channel.title: T2 error
channel.description:
Okay so basically I am running my source through eclipse and its working smoothly and is stable, so then I went looking for a decent client with some cool things, compatible with my source version and I thought I had found the perfect one until I tried to log in, basically I input my username and pass, it goes to a blackscreen u briefly see loading please wait in white print, then it dc's in eclipse it states user david connected, then immediately after like the next line says user david disconnected. in the cmd it states this error :
david size mismatch in getnpcpos - pos:8 psize:11 T2 - 65,81,73 - 11, 3094,3107 - 0,0,7,-1,7,99,-1,-4,32,-128,0,
and i figured that it was the the npc size, which is most commonly set to 14, so i checked the player.java file it stated it was 14(in the source) then since they have to match i checked the client but i couldnt find anything having to do with npcsize?!?!?!?! Knowing me, this is probably a dumb error that im not realizing and is a quick fix, but spare me, does anybody have even the slightest idea whats wrong?

item.title: T2 error
item.dc:creator: @Cript97 Cript97
item.description:
@Cript97 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:5, topic:450850”]Mis-configured NPC bits.

The server and client need to match up.[/quote]

But they do match, I know theyre supposed to, that’s the first thing i looked for, so maybe the client I downloaded just isn’t compatible with whatever the base the source was built off of thanks for the help guys!

Read full topic

item.title: T2 error
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Mis-configured NPC bits.

The server and client need to match up.

Read full topic

item.title: T2 error
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Cript97:

How would I check these? Sorry :s I usually just play rsps, first time taking an attempt at editing my own!

If you didn’t modify packet information, the problem is probably caused by using an incompatible client with your server.

Read full topic

item.title: T2 error
item.dc:creator: @Cript97 Cript97
item.description:
@Cript97 wrote:

How would I check these? Sorry :s I usually just play rsps, first time taking an attempt at editing my own!

Read full topic

item.title: T2 error
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Those are packet misconfiguration errors I believe. Make sure your server is sending correct packet lengths.

Read full topic
